name: Aku Djinn
text: Trample\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature each opponent controls.
flavor: "Your arrogance amazes me, Kaervek. Did you not know the price you would pay?"\n—Mangara

name: Anvil of Bogardan
text: Players have no maximum hand size.\nAt the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card, then discards a card.

name: Archangel
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: "My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."\n—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Army Ants
text: {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target land.
flavor: "Do not underestimate the power of many against one."\n—Sidar Jabari

name: Betrayal
text: Enchant creature an opponent controls\nWhenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, you draw a card.
flavor: "Sometimes a burden can be borne only on the shoulders of a willing enemy."\n—Suq'Ata aphorism

name: Blanket of Night
text: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
flavor: "Kaervek imprisoned Mangara out of jealousy, but he taints Jamuraa simply out of spite."\n—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Bogardan Phoenix
text: Flying\nWhen Bogardan Phoenix dies, exile it if it had a death counter on it. Otherwise, return it to the battlefield under your control and put a death counter on it.

name: Brass-Talon Chimera
text: First strike\nSacrifice Brass-Talon Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains first strike. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Breathstealer's Crypt
text: If a player would draw a card, instead he or she draws a card and reveals it. If it's a creature card, that player discards it unless he or she pays 3 life.
flavor: "Far too many soldiers have died in their beds."\n—Telim'Tor

name: Breezekeeper
text: Flying\nPhasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor: "He blows a gust across the cliff to vanish in a breath of wind."\n—"Song of the Wind Being"

name: Brood of Cockroaches
text: When Brood of Cockroaches is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of the next end step, you lose 1 life and return Brood of Cockroaches to your hand.
flavor: "It's like waking on a bed of a thousand olives during an earthquake of subtle force."\n—Afari, Tales

name: Bull Elephant
text: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.
flavor: Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I?\n—Zhalfirin riddle

name: Chronatog
text: {0}: Chronatog gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor: For the chronatog, there is no meal like the present.

name: City of Solitude
text: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.
flavor: "My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen."\n—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Cloud Elemental
text: Flying\nCloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
flavor: "You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you."\n—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Coercion
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: A rhino's bargain\n—Femeref expression meaning "a situation with no choices"

name: Coral Atoll
text: Coral Atoll enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Coral Atoll enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.\n{T}: Add {C}{U} to your mana pool.

name: Corrosion
text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, put a rust counter on each artifact target opponent controls. Then destroy each artifact with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of rust counters on it. Artifacts destroyed this way can't be regenerated.\nWhen Corrosion leaves the battlefield, remove all rust counters from all permanents.

name: Creeping Mold
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
flavor: "Mold could catch you."\n—Suq'Ata insult

name: Crypt Rats
text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.
flavor: "Once I dreamt of death, but now it dreams of me / And only rats and rotting flesh can hear my silent plea."\n—Mundungu chant

name: Daraja Griffin
text: Flying\nSacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.
flavor: "And the flamingos said, ‘Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you!' So, the griffin ate them."\n—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

name: Dark Privilege
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+1.\nSacrifice a creature: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor: "As you breathe your last, understand why I accept such forbidden gifts."\n—Purraj of Urborg

name: Death Watch
text: Enchant creature\nWhen enchanted creature dies, its controller loses life equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor: "Watch death wait / Wait, death, watch / Steal breath swiftly / but steal life slowly."\n—Suq'Ata dirge

name: Desertion
text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
flavor: First the insult, then the injury.

name: Desolation
text: At the beginning of each end step, each player who tapped a land for mana this turn sacrifices a land. Desolation deals 2 damage to each player who sacrificed a Plains this way.
flavor: "Kill a creature, destroy the present. Kill the land, destroy the future."\n—Kaervek

name: Diamond Kaleidoscope
text: {3}, {T}: Put a 0/1 colorless Prism artifact creature token onto the battlefield.\nSacrifice a Prism token: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
flavor: "A pretty toy. Now show me its tactical applications."\n—Telim'Tor

name: Dormant Volcano
text: Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Mountain you control to its owner's hand.\n{T}: Add {C}{R} to your mana pool.

name: Dragon Mask
text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
flavor: "With no further options, I was forced to don the mask."\n—Rashida Scalebane

name: Dream Tides
text: Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.\nAt the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped nongreen creatures he or she controls and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

name: Dwarven Vigilantes
text: Whenever Dwarven Vigilantes attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Dwarven Vigilantes assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor: Some dwarves can only be pushed so far.

name: Elephant Grass
text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)\nBlack creatures can't attack you.\nNonblack creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.
flavor: "How have I angered nature that she would imprison me in a labyrinth of grass?"\n—Kasib ibn Naji, Letters

name: Elkin Lair
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player exiles a card at random from his or her hand. The player may play that card this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, if the player hasn't played the card, he or she puts it into his or her graveyard.

name: Elven Cache
text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: "The elves can hide better than most can look."\n—Mwani, Mtenda herder

name: Emerald Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Untap target permanent.
• Destroy target non-Aura enchantment.
• Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

name: Equipoise
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, for each land target player controls in excess of the number you control, choose a land he or she controls, then the chosen permanents phase out. Repeat this process for artifacts and creatures. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before that player untaps during his or her next untap step.)

name: Everglades
text: Everglades enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Everglades enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Swamp you control to its owner's hand.\n{T}: Add {C}{B} to your mana pool.

name: Eye of Singularity
text: When Eye of Singularity enters the battlefield, destroy each permanent with the same name as another permanent, except for basic lands. They can't be regenerated.\nWhenever a permanent other than a basic land enters the battlefield, destroy all other permanents with that name. They can't be regenerated.

name: Fallen Askari
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)\nFallen Askari can't block.
flavor: In troubled times, there are few greater sorrows than a wayward savior.

name: Femeref Enchantress
text: Whenever an enchantment is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor: "Then she spread a fine dust over the land, like a butterfly shaking its wing."\n—"The Enchantress," Femeref tale

name: Feral Instinct
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: "If a rhino's head is lower than its shoulders, trust me—it is not praying."\n—Mwani, Mtenda herder

name: Fireblast
text: You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Fireblast's mana cost.\nFireblast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Embermages aren't well known for their diplomatic skills.

name: Firestorm Hellkite
text: Flying, trample\nCumulative upkeep {U}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
flavor: "If it can scar the sky with fire, do not share its destination."\n—Mwani, Mtenda herder

name: Flooded Shoreline
text: {U}{U}, Return two Islands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Some say the sea is jealous of the land and wishes to climb its heights to meet the sky."\n—Afari, Tales

name: Forbidden Ritual
text: Sacrifice a nontoken permanent. If you do, target opponent loses 2 life unless he or she sacrifices a permanent or discards a card. You may repeat this process any number of times.

name: Foreshadow
text: Name a card, then target opponent puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you draw a card.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Freewind Falcon
text: Flying, protection from red
flavor: "That does it! I'm going back to hunting chickens!"\n—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Funeral Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Target player discards a card.
• Target creature gets +2/-1 until end of turn.
• Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

name: Giant Caterpillar
text: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly onto the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor: "‘I've seen hornworms big as a man's fist,' the traveler said, and nodded soberly when our jaws went slack at his ignorance."\n—Afari, Tales

name: Goblin Recruiter
text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
flavor: "Next!"

name: Goblin Swine-Rider
text: Whenever Goblin Swine-Rider becomes blocked, it deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and each blocking creature.
flavor: "May you get the mount you deserve."\n—Suq'Ata curse

name: Gossamer Chains
text: Return Gossamer Chains to its owner's hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target unblocked creature this turn.
flavor: "Harah swung his sword mightily, but still the air held him fast."\n—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

name: Griffin Canyon
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Untap target Griffin. If it's a creature, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Where are falling feathers deadlier than falling rock?"\n—The One Thousand Questions

name: Guiding Spirit
text: Flying\n{T}: If the top card of target player's graveyard is a creature card, put that card on top of that player's library.
flavor: "Retainer of eternal Sun! Life flash again upon thy wings."\n—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

name: Hearth Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact creature.
• Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Heat Wave
text: Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)\nBlue creatures can't block creatures you control.\nNonblue creatures can't block creatures you control unless their controller pays 1 life for each blocking creature he or she controls.

name: Helm of Awakening
text: Spells cost {1} less to cast.
flavor: "This little prize will cover your head, your spells, your bets, and your behind!"\n—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

name: Honorable Passage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals that much damage to the source's controller.

name: Hope Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
• Target player gains 2 life.
• Destroy target Aura.

name: Hulking Cyclops
text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
flavor: "Some say a great cyclops turns the world in its hands, looking down upon it with its one bright eye."\n—Afari, Tales

name: Impulse
text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor: "Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."\n—Teferi

name: Infantry Veteran
text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."\n—Telim'Tor

name: Infernal Harvest
text: As an additional cost to cast Infernal Harvest, return X Swamps you control to their owner's hand.\nInfernal Harvest deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
flavor: "I offered you eternal life; I just didn't say where."\n—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Inspiration
text: Target player draws two cards.
flavor: "Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."\n—Sidar Jabari

name: Iron-Heart Chimera
text: Vigilance\nSacrifice Iron-Heart Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains vigilance. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Jamuraan Lion
text: {W}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
flavor: The lion blinked\n—Femeref expression meaning "situation avoided"

name: Juju Bubble
text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)\nWhen you play a card, sacrifice Juju Bubble.\n{2}: You gain 1 life.
flavor: "If my heart had a lid, I would lift it and show you my joy."\n—From Suq'Ata wedding ceremony

name: Jungle Basin
text: Jungle Basin enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Jungle Basin enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Forest you control to its owner's hand.\n{T}: Add {C}{G} to your mana pool.

name: Kaervek's Spite
text: As an additional cost to cast Kaervek's Spite, sacrifice all permanents you control and discard your hand.\nTarget player loses 5 life.
flavor: "The end justifies the means. What do I care if I rule over the dead rather than over the living? The dead ask fewer questions."\n—Kaervek

name: Karoo
text: Karoo enters the battlefield tapped.\nWhen Karoo enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Plains you control to its owner's hand.\n{T}: Add {C}{W} to your mana pool.

name: Katabatic Winds
text: Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)\nCreatures with flying can't attack or block, and their activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.
flavor: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

name: Keeper of Kookus
text: {R}: Keeper of Kookus gains protection from red until end of turn.
flavor: Wanted: Thick-skinned goblin for guarding mean ol' Kookus. Must like fires. Must heal quickly.

name: King Cheetah
text: Flash
flavor: If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a King Cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.\n—Suq'Ata wisdom

name: Knight of the Mists
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)\nWhen Knight of the Mists enters the battlefield, you may pay {U}. If you don't, destroy target Knight and it can't be regenerated.
flavor: Fear the mists, for they are armed.

name: Knight of Valor
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)\n{1}{W}: Each creature without flanking blocking Knight of Valor gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Kookus
text: Trample\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, if you don't control a creature named Keeper of Kookus, Kookus deals 3 damage to you and attacks this turn if able.\n{R}: Kookus gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Kyscu Drake
text: Flying\n{G}: Kyscu Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.\nSacrifice Kyscu Drake and a creature named Spitting Drake: Search your library for a card named Viashivan Dragon and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Lead-Belly Chimera
text: Trample\nSacrifice Lead-Belly Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Lichenthrope
text: If damage would be dealt to Lichenthrope, put that many -1/-1 counters on it instead.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from Lichenthrope.

name: Lightning Cloud
text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {R}. If you do, Lightning Cloud deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: The mightiest clouds sit upon spires of fire.\n—Femeref adage

name: Longbow Archer
text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "If it bears wings, I will pin it to the skies over Tefemburu."\n—Ruya, Zhalfirin archer

name: Magma Mine
text: {4}: Put a pressure counter on Magma Mine.\n{T}, Sacrifice Magma Mine: Magma Mine deals damage equal to the number of pressure counters on it to target creature or player.
flavor: BOOM!

name: Man-o'-War
text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."\n—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Matopi Golem
text: {1}: Regenerate Matopi Golem. When it regenerates this way, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor: Some potmakers claim to use the mud of such creatures to make their finest bowls—and that the bowls scream when fired.

name: Miraculous Recovery
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor: "You stop breathing for just a few minutes and everyone jumps to conclusions."\n—Zarkuu, necrosavant

name: Mob Mentality
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has trample.\nWhenever all non-Wall creatures you control attack, enchanted creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
flavor: "Why is loud stupidity so infectious?"\n—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Mortal Wound
text: Enchant creature\nWhen enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
flavor: "Their tears spill over Jamuraa. Mixed with blood, they wash everything red."\n—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Mundungu
text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} and 1 life.
flavor: "Our buried kings silently await the revolt of dead peasants."\n—Tuwile, mundungu of Aku

name: Mystic Veil
text: You may cast Mystic Veil as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.\nEnchant creature\nEnchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: "Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were."\n—Poetics of Hanan

name: Natural Order
text: As an additional cost to cast Natural Order, sacrifice a green creature.\nSearch your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: . . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life.

name: Necromancy
text: You may cast Necromancy as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.\nWhen Necromancy enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Necromancy." Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control and attach Necromancy to it. When Necromancy leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.

name: Necrosavant
text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
flavor: "Ah, I remember my first death."\n—Zarkuu, necrosavant

name: Nekrataal
text: First strike\nWhen Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
flavor: "I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."\n—Jolrael

name: Ogre Enforcer
text: Ogre Enforcer can't be destroyed by lethal damage unless lethal damage dealt by a single source is marked on it.
flavor: "Ate up all of his siblings in the first week. A good beginning for one destined to command."\n—Suka, ogre matron

name: Ovinomancer
text: When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.\n{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller puts a 0/1 green Sheep creature token onto the battlefield.

name: Panther Warriors
flavor: "When you run you're graceful and swift, sleek as a powerful panther."\n—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Parapet
text: You may cast Parapet as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.\nCreatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor: There is no wall that can't be improved by making it taller.

name: Peace Talks
text: This turn and next turn, creatures can't attack, and players and permanents can't be the targets of spells or activated abilities.
flavor: "By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."\n—Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat

name: Phyrexian Marauder
text: Phyrexian Marauder enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.\nPhyrexian Marauder can't block.\nPhyrexian Marauder can't attack unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Phyrexian Walker
flavor: "I have heard terrible tales of black rains, ashen fields, and metal that screams. I have consoled myself that the tales were a myth of some fevered mind. But today I saw a walker—and now I fear the truth."\n—Kasib Ibn Naji, Letters

name: Pillar Tombs of Aku
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may sacrifice a creature. If that player doesn't, he or she loses 5 life and you sacrifice Pillar Tombs of Aku.
flavor: "Aku, City of Hidden Graves / Aku, City of Lost Kings / Aku, welcome me."\n—Pillar tomb inscription

name: Prosperity
text: Each player draws X cards.
flavor: "Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."\n—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

name: Pygmy Hippo
text: Whenever Pygmy Hippo attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player activate a mana ability of each land he or she controls and empty his or her mana pool. If you do, Pygmy Hippo assigns no combat damage this turn and at the beginning of your next main phase this turn, you add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to the amount of mana emptied from that player's mana pool this way.

name: Python
flavor: "How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"\n—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Quicksand
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.

name: Quirion Druid
text: {G}, {T}: Target land becomes a 2/2 green creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor: "The land has been gracious enough to let you tread upon her for years. That privilege is about to end."\n—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

name: Quirion Ranger
text: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor: "Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket."\n—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

name: Raging Gorilla
text: Whenever Raging Gorilla blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor: "Every temper tantrum makes another angry gorilla."\n—Femeref children's myth

name: Rainbow Efreet
text: Flying\n{U}{U}: Rainbow Efreet phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
flavor: "A beauty made more so by its fleeting visitations."\n—Teferi

name: Relentless Assault
text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
flavor: "Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."\n—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry

name: Relic Ward
text: You may cast Relic Ward as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.\nEnchant artifact\nEnchanted artifact has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor: Asmira's prayers alone should have freed Mangara from the amber prison . . .

name: Remedy
text: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.
flavor: "These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."\n—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Resistance Fighter
text: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
flavor: "My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."\n—Sidar Jabari

name: Retribution of the Meek
text: Destroy all creatures with power 4 or greater. They can't be regenerated.
flavor: "Tread upon the meek, and they shall wound your feet and make you crawl."\n—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Righteous Aura
text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor: "Good is not a ‘thing.' You can neither touch nor own it. No, Good is a vision we all share and strive to make real."\n—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Righteous War
text: White creatures you control have protection from black.\nBlack creatures you control have protection from white.
flavor: "This is a war without neutrality."\n—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: River Boa
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)\n{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
flavor: "But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."\n—Afari, Tales

name: Rock Slide
text: Rock Slide deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures without flying.
flavor: "Good ol' rock. Nothing beats rock."\n—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Rowen
text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
flavor: "I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."\n—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Sands of Time
text: Each player skips his or her untap step.\nAt the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player simultaneously untaps each tapped artifact, creature, and land he or she controls and taps each untapped artifact, creature, and land he or she controls.
flavor: "But once, with a magician's help, Time was stopped and Day stood still."\n—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Scalebane's Elite
text: Protection from black
flavor: "With Rashida's blades, my guiding vision and the luck of the blessed, today we will free Mangara!"\n—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Shimmering Efreet
text: Flying\nPhasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)\nWhenever Shimmering Efreet phases in, target creature phases out. (It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
flavor: Life or death: which is the illusion?"\n—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Shrieking Drake
text: Flying\nWhen Shrieking Drake enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Kaervek believes the drakes' cries herald his victory; in truth, they mourn aloud for his impending demise."\n—Teferi

name: Simoon
text: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.
flavor: "The black-and-white sacred monkey holds her children to her, and waits."\n—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Sisay's Ring
text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.
flavor: "With this ring, you have friends in worlds you've never heard of."\n—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Snake Basket
text: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Put X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor: "Uh, does anyone have a flute?"\n—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Solfatara
text: Target player can't play land cards this turn.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: "A burst of hot air tossed the moon into the air, and the moon liked it up there so much it never needed the ground again."\n—Azeworai, "Glitter Moon"

name: Song of Blood
text: Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard.\nWhenever a creature attacks this turn, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each creature card put into your graveyard this way.
flavor: Purraj sang slaughter and danced death.

name: Spider Climb
text: You may cast Spider Climb as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.\nEnchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +0/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

name: Spitting Drake
text: Flying\n{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.

name: Squandered Resources
text: Sacrifice a land: Add to your mana pool one mana of any type the sacrificed land could produce.
flavor: "He traded sand for skins, skins for gold, gold for life. In the end, he traded life for sand."\n—Afari, Tales

name: Stampeding Wildebeests
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: Prayers for rain are answered with the thunder of hooves.

name: Suleiman's Legacy
text: When Suleiman's Legacy enters the battlefield, destroy all Djinns and Efreets. They can't be regenerated.\nWhenever a Djinn or Efreet enters the battlefield, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: With Suleiman's ascension to power, the djinn and efreets of ancient Rabiah learned humility.

name: Summer Bloom
text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
flavor: "Our love is like the river in the summer season of long rains. / For a little while it spilled its banks, flooding the crops in the fields."\n—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Sun Clasp
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+3.\n{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: "And darkness shall be cast from me\nFor my soul resides in the Sun."\n—Femeref dirge

name: Suq'Ata Assassin
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)\nWhenever Suq'Ata Assassin attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

name: Suq'Ata Lancer
text: Haste\nFlanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
flavor: "Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side."\n—Telim'Tor

name: Talruum Champion
text: First strike\nWhenever Talruum Champion blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature loses first strike until end of turn.
flavor: In the Talruum language, there is no word for "surprised."

name: Talruum Piper
text: All creatures with flying able to block Talruum Piper do so.
flavor: When the Talruum began to play, the dragons fell from the sky to squash the obnoxious noise.

name: Tar Pit Warrior
text: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor: "The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."\n—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

name: Teferi's Honor Guard
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)\n{U}{U}: Teferi's Honor Guard phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
flavor: "They may seem ceremonial, but their swords are still sharp."\n—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

name: Teferi's Realm
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses artifact, creature, land, or non-Aura enchantment. All nontoken permanents of that type phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
flavor: "Fire is dead. Water has killed him."\n—From The Stories of Nature

name: Tempest Drake
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: "Its speed will be equaled only by the swiftness of my enemy's fall."\n—Kaervek

name: Three Wishes
text: Exile the top three cards of your library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled. Until your next turn, you may play those cards. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put any of those cards you didn't play into your graveyard.

name: Time and Tide
text: Simultaneously, all phased-out creatures phase in and all creatures with phasing phase out.
flavor: "Time may heal all wounds, but what heals time?"\n—Teferi

name: Tin-Wing Chimera
text: Flying\nSacrifice Tin-Wing Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Tithe
text: Search your library for a Plains card. If target opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Tremor
text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor: "Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"\n—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Triangle of War
text: {2}, Sacrifice Triangle of War: Target creature you control fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor: The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.

name: Uktabi Orangutan
text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
flavor: "Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"\n—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Undiscovered Paradise
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. During your next untap step, as you untap your permanents, return Undiscovered Paradise to its owner's hand.
flavor: Jolrael's choice of homes was far better than her choice of allies.

name: Undo
text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: "Oft have I wished to undo past deeds, but never did I imagine they would be undone for me."\n—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Urborg Mindsucker
text: {B}, Sacrifice Urborg Mindsucker: Target opponent discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor: "My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine."\n—Kaervek

name: Vampiric Tutor
text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
flavor: "I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."\n—Shauku, Endbringer

name: Vampirism
text:
Enchant creature
When Vampirism enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
Other creatures you control get -1/-1.

name: Vanishing
text: Enchant creature\n{U}{U}: Enchanted creature phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)
flavor: "Careless, like a child with fire, so was I with time."\n—Teferi

name: Viashino Sandstalker
text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)\nAt the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
flavor: "Some believe Sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."\n—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

name: Viashivan Dragon
text: Flying\n{R}: Viashivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.\n{G}: Viashivan Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The Viashivan understand that cruelty arises from opportunity.

name: Vision Charm
text:
Choose one —
• Target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
• Choose a land type and a basic land type. Each land of the first chosen type becomes the second chosen type until end of turn.
• Target artifact phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during his or her next untap step.)

name: Wake of Vultures
text: Flying\n{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.
flavor: "So the vulture said to the griffin, ‘You gonna eat that?'"\n—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

name: Wand of Denial
text: {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it's a nonland card, you may pay 2 life. If you do, put it into that player's graveyard.
flavor: You'll never miss what you never had.

name: Warrior's Honor
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket."\n—Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant

name: Warthog
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: "Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."\n—Grebog, goblin swine-rider

name: Waterspout Djinn
text: Flying\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Waterspout Djinn unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Fly us higher, out of its storm."\n—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Wicked Reward
text: As an additional cost to cast Wicked Reward, sacrifice a creature.\nTarget creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition."\n—Kaervek

name: Wind Shear
text: Attacking creatures with flying get -2/-2 and lose flying until end of turn.
flavor: "As the winds abated, there was a shower of dragonscales, then nothing more."\n—Azeworai, "The Unruly Wind"

name: Zhalfirin Crusader
text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)\n{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zhalfirin Crusader this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.
flavor: "War is the crucible of leadership."\n—Rashida Scalebane
